Steps.Message: Update at 10:11 - We're sorry you''e still without power. Our engineers are making progress with repairs, but are anticipating they will take longer than was originally thought. To give them time to complete their work, we have had to make a change to the timeframe. We're now estimating to have you back on between 11:30 and 12:30. We're sorry the time has changed and appreciate how frustrating this can be. We'll have your power back on as soon as we can.

We became aware of this power cut at 04:32. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Engineers investigating and fixing

Logs.Comment: Update at 10:11 - We're sorry you''e still without power. Our engineers are making progress with repairs, but are anticipating they will take longer than was originally thought. To give them time to complete their work, we have had to make a change to the timeframe. We're now estimating to have you back on between 11:30 and 12:30. We're sorry the time has changed and appreciate how frustrating this can be. We'll have your power back on as soon as we can.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: An underground electricity cable faulted on our high voltage network, causing an area wide power cut.
